playlistwidgetnew Class Reference

The playlistwidgetnew-class itself This widget organises a playlist, with all functionality needed for a playlist.
It automatically groups all playlisttracks into playlistalbums, and reorganises them on drag and drop.
Also all tracks get actualised automatically, when the files change on disc:
-Regrouping in new albums, if the album changes.
-Update the Coverpicture of playlistalbum.
-Remove of Tracks from the playlist, if file got deleted on disc.
. More...

#include <playlistwidgetnew.h>

List of all members.

Signals

void trackcountchange (int)
 trackcountchange-signal This signal is emitted, when the number of tracks in the widget changes.
It does not matter which way is used to in or decrease the tracks. (addsong,dragging,...)

void clearactionsignal ()
 clearactionsignal This signal is emitted, when clear playlist is selected in the contextmenu of the widget

 removeactionsignal This signal is emitted, when delete tracks is selected in the contextmenu of the widget.

 actualchange-signal This signal is emitted, when the actual-tarck is changed.
void actualfilechangedtags ()
 actualfilechangedtags-sgnal This signal is emitted, when the actualfile has changed tags, so the playing-widget can update its contents.

 insertsong-function for filenames Inserts a song in front of the given insertionpoint.
It is automatically checked if the track matches to the albums in it is between.
If the albums donÂ´t match, there is a new album generated, that is inserted in between

void insertsong (QTreeWidgetItem *draggeditem, QTreeWidgetItem *insertionpoint)
 insertsong-function for QTreeWidgetItem This function is used for the drag and drop-part, since playlisttrack and playlistalbum are directly derived from QTreeWidgetItem this is the function for dragging internally.

 getplaylist-function
const playlisttrack * skiptonext ()
 skiptonext-function This function skips to the next track in playlist. It automatically sets the activetrack to the next playlisttrack in list.
If repeatmode is on, after the last track the first track gets active.
If there is a valid next track, a pointer to it is returned.
If there is no valid next track a NULL-pointer is returned.
const playlisttrack * skiptoprev ()
 skiptonprev-function This function skips to the previous track in playlist. It automatically sets the activetrack to the prev playlisttrack in list.
If repeatmode is on, after the first track the last track gets active.
If there is a valid prev track, a pointer to it is returned.
If there is no valid prev track a NULL-pointer is returned.
playlisttrack * getactivetrack ()
 getactivetrack-function
void recalcall ()
 recalcall-function This function recalcs all albums, and deletes albums not containing any tracks.
It also recalculates the shown time per album and the whole time displayed at top right of the widget.

void setrepeatmode (bool mode)
 setrepeatmode-function

Detailed Description

The playlistwidgetnew-class itself This widget organises a playlist, with all functionality needed for a playlist.
It automatically groups all playlisttracks into playlistalbums, and reorganises them on drag and drop.
Also all tracks get actualised automatically, when the files change on disc:
-Regrouping in new albums, if the album changes.
-Update the Coverpicture of playlistalbum.
-Remove of Tracks from the playlist, if file got deleted on disc.
.

addsong-function for internal drag and drop This function is used for dragging internally normally.
It appends the track at the end of the playlist.

track a playlisttrack

void playlistwidgetnew::addsong ( const QString  filename  ) 

addsong-function Adds a song on the eend of the playlist. It automatically creates a new album, if the track does not match with the last album.

Parameters:
filename The filename of the file to append on playlist. If there stands a ###ACTIVE#### in front of it, it gets set active

playlisttrack * playlistwidgetnew::getactivetrack (  ) 

getactivetrack-function

Returns:
a pointer to the active track, or a NULL-pointer if there is no activetrack

const QStringList playlistwidgetnew::getplaylist (  ) 

getplaylist-function

Returns:
a QStringList with the files that are in playlist. The active track gets a ###ACTIVE#### in front

void playlistwidgetnew::insertsong ( QTreeWidgetItem *  draggeditem,
QTreeWidgetItem *  insertionpoint 
)

insertsong-function for QTreeWidgetItem This function is used for the drag and drop-part, since playlisttrack and playlistalbum are directly derived from QTreeWidgetItem this is the function for dragging internally.

Parameters:
draggeditem The item that is moved somewhere else
insertionpoint The item the draggeditem is inserted in front

void playlistwidgetnew::insertsong ( const QString  filename,
QTreeWidgetItem *  insertionpoint 
)

insertsong-function for filenames Inserts a song in front of the given insertionpoint.
It is automatically checked if the track matches to the albums in it is between.
If the albums donÂ´t match, there is a new album generated, that is inserted in between

Parameters:
filename the filename, that should be inserted.
insertionpoint The item of the playlist the insert is in front of. (All inserts allways go in front)

void playlistwidgetnew::removeactionsignal ( const QList< QTreeWidgetItem * >  items  )  [signal]

removeactionsignal This signal is emitted, when delete tracks is selected in the contextmenu of the widget.

Parameters:
items a QList of QTreeWidgetItem that should be removed from the playist

void playlistwidgetnew::setrepeatmode ( bool  mode  ) 

setrepeatmode-function

Parameters:
mode the new repeatmode. TRUE means repeat on.

const playlisttrack * playlistwidgetnew::skiptonext (  ) 

skiptonext-function This function skips to the next track in playlist. It automatically sets the activetrack to the next playlisttrack in list.
If repeatmode is on, after the last track the first track gets active.
If there is a valid next track, a pointer to it is returned.
If there is no valid next track a NULL-pointer is returned.

Returns:
a pointer to the next playlisttrack

const playlisttrack * playlistwidgetnew::skiptoprev (  ) 

skiptonprev-function This function skips to the previous track in playlist. It automatically sets the activetrack to the prev playlisttrack in list.
If repeatmode is on, after the first track the last track gets active.
If there is a valid prev track, a pointer to it is returned.
If there is no valid prev track a NULL-pointer is returned.

Returns:
a pointer to the prev playlisttrack
